meanings.sent1: The fogies in the neighborhood always prefer traditional music.
meanings.sent2: The fogies at the town hall meeting resisted any changes to the local park.
meanings.sent3: The fogies at the party refused to dance to modern music.
meanings.sent4: The fogies in the office were like relics from a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The fogies' insistence on handwritten letters seemed charmingly outdated.

meanings.definition: Plural form of 'fogy', meaning an old-fashioned or conservative person.
meanings.sent1: The group of fogies gathered at the park every morning for their routine walk.
meanings.sent2: The fogies shared stories of the good old days over a cup of tea.
meanings.sent3: The fogies' love for black-and-white movies was endearingly nostalgic.
meanings.sent4: The fogies' antique collection made their home feel like a museum.
meanings.sent5: The fogies' dedication to tradition was unwavering and admirable.
